fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper

Class UserDataBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.fluent.AbstractParent<CloudhopperBuilder>
      • fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.cloudhopper.UserDataBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<UserDataBuilder.UserDataPropValues>, Parent<CloudhopperBuilder>

    public class UserDataBuilder
extends AbstractParent<CloudhopperBuilder>
implements Builder<UserDataBuilder.UserDataPropValues>
    "User Data" represents the text message or data to be transmitted the end-user.

    The length of the short message text (or user data) is defined in the sm_length field of the submit_sm, submit_multi, deliver_sm and replace_sm SMPP PDUs. The maximum message length which can be specified in sm_length field is 254 octets. If an ESME wishes to submit a message of length greater than 254 octets, the sm_length field must be set to NULL and the message_payload optional parameter must be populated with the message length value and user data. SMPP supports extended message lengths in the submit_sm, submit_multi, data_sm and deliver_sm PDUs. Note: The actual short message length which can be transmitted to a MS may vary according to the underlying network.

    This builder allows to select which field to use:

    • either short_message fields
    • or message_payload optional TLV (Tag-Length-Value) parameter
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserDataBuilder

        public UserDataBuilder(CloudhopperBuilder parent,
                       BuildContext buildContext)
        Initializes the builder with a parent builder. The parent builder is used when calling AbstractParent.and() method. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate properties when build() method is called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        buildContext - for registering instances and property evaluation

    • Method Detail

      • useShortMessage

        public UserDataBuilder useShortMessage(Boolean useShortMessage)
        Enable/disable use of short_message field.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using useShortMessage(). 

         .useShortMessage(true)
 .useShortMessage()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
 
         .useShortMessage(true)
 .useShortMessage()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
        In both cases, useShortMessage(true) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        useShortMessage - enable (true) or disable (false) use of short_message field
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • useShortMessage

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<UserDataBuilder,Boolean> useShortMessage()
        Enable/disable use of short_message field to carry text message (named User Data).

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .useShortMessage()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)

        Non-null value set using useShortMessage(Boolean) takes precedence over property values and default value: 

         .useShortMessage(false)
 .useShortMessage()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)
        The value false is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value

      • useTlvMessagePayload

        public UserDataBuilder useTlvMessagePayload(Boolean useTlvMessagePayload)
        Enable/disable use of message_payload optional TLV (Tag-Value-Length) parameter to carry text message (named User Data). NOTE: The TLV optional parameters are available since SMPP version 3.4.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using useTlvMessagePayload(). 

         .useTlvMessagePayload(false)
 .useTlvMessagePayload()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)
 
         .useTlvMessagePayload(false)
 .useTlvMessagePayload()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)
        In both cases, useTlvMessagePayload(false) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        useTlvMessagePayload - enable (true) or disable (false) use of message_payload optional parameter to carry text message
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • useTlvMessagePayload

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<UserDataBuilder,Boolean> useTlvMessagePayload()
        Enable/disable use of message_payload optional TLV (Tag-Value-Length) parameter to carry text message (named User Data).

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .useTlvMessagePayload()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)

        Non-null value set using useTlvMessagePayload(Boolean) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .useTlvMessagePayload(false)
 .useTlvMessagePayload()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(true)
        The value false is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value
